newsitem.title: SUDAN: Sudan to sell main prison due to overcrowding.
newsitem.headline: Sudan to sell main prison due to overcrowding.

text.p: Sudan has put its main prison up for sale because of overcrowding, a newspaper said on Tuesday.
The privately owned al-Rai al-Akher said the Ministries of Finance and Internal Affairs were discussing the value of the prison in Khartoum's twin city Ombdurman.
The paper said there were 1,200 inmates and the prison could not handle the increasing numbers.
"This affects the health and environment in the prison and the surrounding area," it quoted the director of the prison force, Major General al-Shaikh al-Rayah al-Shaikh, as saying.
A recent visit by officials to the prison led to plans to move it to al-Hadi town west of Omdurman, he said.
